alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 19 at 5:44AM EDT until March 19 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Gadsden County in Big Bend Florida... Northwestern Liberty County in Big Bend Florida... Central Calhoun County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 745 AM CDT /845 AM EDT/. * At 444 AM CDT /544 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour which has led to rainfall totals of around 8 inches in portions of the area over the past 12 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blountstown, Altha, Blountstown Airport, Red Oak, Chipola, Durham, Kennys Mill, Nettle Ridge, Clarksville, Macedonia, Chason, Sharpstown, Willis, Selman, Henderson Mill, Abe Springs, Hugh Creek, White Pond, Frink and Ocheesee. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
